intro: Cissus migeodii, commonly known as the rock fig or African rock fig, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Vitaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a fleshy, yellowish berry that contains several seeds. Cissus migeodii is often found growing on rocky surfaces and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
